definition: surname Wei/ancient Chinese state near present day Chongqing/Taiwan pr. [Wei2]
to withdraw/to pull back/to contract/to shrink/to reduce/abbreviation/also pr. [su4]

sentences.english: If only someone could now miniaturise gas masks.
sentences.chinese: 哈，現在就差有誰能夠搞個微縮版防毒面具出來。

sentences.english: The dream made the "mimi Italy" park in Rimini.
sentences.chinese: 這個夢想成就了裏米尼的“微縮意大利”公園。

sentences.english: Government documents, periodicals, microfilms or fiche, audiovisual, and maps.
sentences.chinese: 政府文件，期刊，微縮膠捲，視聽資料，地圖等。

sentences.english: Here with microtext, you can really print it on there.
sentences.chinese: 在微縮資料中，你可以把它打印出來。

sentences.english: In the museum there is a miniature of the ship "Mayflower".
sentences.chinese: 在博物館裏有一個“五月花號”船的微縮模型。

sentences.english: Think of it as a microcosm of the universe.
sentences.chinese: 你應該把這看做是宇宙的微縮標本。

sentences.english: There is now a built in Stopwatch and Alarm clock feature that can be found on the bottom of the minimap.
sentences.chinese: 現在在微縮地圖底部加入了秒錶和鬧鐘的設計。

sentences.english: If you use the atlases on microfilm, copies are easily made.
sentences.chinese: 如果利用微縮膠片地圖集，那麼很容易製作拷貝品。

sentences.english: Crocodile Farm, Miniature Replicas of Angkor's Temples.
sentences.chinese: 鱷魚農場，吳哥遺址微縮景觀公園。

definition: to come up with an idea/generation of ideas/inspiration
to adjust one's head and turn one's face (idiom); cosmetic changes/Despite superficially new policies, the substance remains unchanged.
to merge together (idiom); to unify disparate elements into one whole
